Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as the study referenced in the claim did not make the assertion that conspiracy theorists are generally more sane than other people.
Problematic assumption: The claim is based on the flawed interpretation and assumption that the views expressed in the comments section of news articles about 9/11 consistently represent conventional wisdom.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the study did not make the assertion that conspiracy theorists are generally more sane than other people.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the findings of the study by misrepresenting its conclusions.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the observed differences in comments between conspiracy theorists and conventionalists.
